review_title: A values driven place to work
job_title: Head of HR Operations in Coventry, England
pros: Having moved from a profit focussed working sector for over 24 years, I moved to Langley to work somewhere that both aligned with my personal values and had a clear positive impact on community. Langley has definitely delivered this. The values aren't just posters on the wall - they are practiced every day.
cons: Because we are so passionate about what we do it can become all-consuming.

pros: Interesting clients Free meal on shift
cons: Dangerous situations Unsupportive management Bullying Insufficient training Long shifts Limited career advancement opportunities

Staff treat new people with arrogance, they treat agencies and cleaning staff likewise. I doubt if Jesus would recognise himself in them.
When a manager leads a prayer that starts ' please let the Russian economy crash', I began to doubt the integrity.
I left after three shifts, because at a residents meeting, service users were told they were to have no more desserts other than yogurt and fruit ( even though the medication they are prescribed, can make them gain weight). Staff were interested in looking for healthier recipes, and one even taunted service users with a giant chocolate bar.
The manager didn't seem to have a problem with that, and I judged that I'd likely gain weight too, as staff spent most of their time looking in computers . The big deal was making it look like lots of interaction went on , so they could claim money from the authorities placing the service users . Very Christian.

pros: Fulfilling, fun, training is good, shift pattern is good.
cons: No cons with the company or job role.

pros:
My experience working for Langley has been a positive one. In my opinion, the culture here is one of respect and responsibility and the leadership team set a clear vision for the organisation which is helpful. 
In my role, there have been access to professional development opportunities and feels the same across the organisation. The trust has been pushing it's EDI agenda in the last year with clear actions and updates to all employee's which is refreshing to see.
cons: Sometimes, long hours in front of a computer but people are encouraged to move from the computer once every hour.

pros: Regular supervisions and support, great training and friendly teams
cons: potential for work to be stressful, nature of this line of work.

job_title: Support Worker in Bury, North West England, England
pros: Constant training, opportunity for overtime, very rewarding
cons: Poor management - wrong people in the wrong roles

pros: At Langley House Trust there is opportunity to support a minority group of people who, in many situations and opportunities, are overlooked.
cons: An odd place.  It is a Christian organisation which is great if you're a Christian.  All managerial positions are Christian,  all meetings start with prayers. I loved my job, working with ex-offenders supporting towards independent living.  However when it all boils down to it, it's all about the money which is by way of HB, supported persons, funding etc. At times I felt that the actual support was a cover for a money makng machine.

pros: Langley is a very supportive environment to work in.  There is lots of training for us as staff.  The managers are busy but easy talk to and want to listen.   Work is varied and no two days are the same.  It's good to see when our clients do well.
cons: There is always lots to do in a day.  It's not always easy work but I think it's worth it.
